## Rivest Shamir Adleman ##

We are given the brief:
```These 3 guys encrypted my flag, but they didn't tell me how to decrypt it.```

and the source: 
```
n = 
e = 65537
c = 
```

Looking at the first letter of each word of the title, or if you've ever seen one before, it's pretty obvious that this is an RSA challenge. 

Now you can either do this manually, or using the great tool [RsaCtfTool](https://github.com/Ganapati/RsaCtfTool).

I decided to cheese it and use RsaCtfTool. 

Simply inputting the values as so, we get our flag:

```
./RsaCtfTool.py -n  -e 65537 --uncipher 
```

`csictf{sh0uld'v3_t4k3n_b1gg3r_pr1m3s}`
